title: General Manager of Kids Coding School
description:
Who We Are
theCoderSchool is an after-school drop-off program for students ages 7 to 18 learning to code. We are the #1 after-school coding program in Silicon Valley with 50+ locations nationwide and growing. Our mission is to get kids coding, which instills a life-long confidence in technology and serves as an incredibly useful, creative skill.

sanramon.thecoderschool.com
Job Summary
theCoderSchool is looking for a passionate General Manager (GM) to grow our school to new heights! You will be the captain of your own ship and get the opportunity to:
  
    Grow a coding community of kids!
    Meet and communicate with parents - many of whom will be techies themselves, who work at some of the best companies and startups in the area.
    Meet and communicate with school teachers, PTA parents, and local businesses to create opportunities for kids to code.
    Be a part of and learn from a passionate team of 5 GMs (We are a franchisee of the greater organization; 2 of our 5 are top 2 in the nation) fueled by our mission to get more kids to code! 
  
  This is a full-time position. A typical school's open hours are weekdays 3:30-7:30pm and Saturdays 10am-3pm, but GMs work outside of these hours regularly. Our top GM’s labor of love keeps them busy throughout the week and they earn six figures from salary and profit share.

Responsibilities
The GM is the person in charge of the day-to-day operations and growing the school. The key responsibilities are to:
  
   Ensure students are having an engaging and productive learning experience.   
  Make families happy (via smooth operations: scheduling, customer service, staffing, etc.).   
  Grow the community (via Sales & Marketing activities and team culture).
  

Requirements
Candidates must be:
  
    Excited about coding for kids. You genuinely believe in our mission to get kids coding and have an easy time inspiring others to join the cause. Coding has impacted your life in a big way and you want to pay it forward to the next generation.
    Organized techie.  You have a natural sense of orderliness/organization and have a comfort of multitasking across multiple web applications (keep track of a complex schedule for hundreds of students, HR, events, sales & marketing processes using a myriad of web applications). You don’t need to know how to code but the idea of adopting new programs and platforms to streamline your work piques your curiosity.
    Driven.  You are excited by growing a business and are constantly figuring out ways to bring in new students.
    Decisive. You are comfortable making quick, logical decisions under pressure while balancing a variety of priorities.
    Great with people, especially kids. We are a people-centric business from managing our young adult coaches to establishing relationships with parents and members of your community.
  

Nice to have
Great candidates may also be:

  Experienced in CS & education. We can train you on how to hire and manage your technical coaches if you are not technical, but a technical and education (tutoring or the like) background to support the students learning experiences and even coach students several hours per week may be helpful.
A community ring-leader. You love to bring people together by organizing activities and events. This is a coding community where we can create new camps, hack-a-thons, workshops, game nights etc to expand the school’s presence in the community.

  Naturally inclined to outreach. The best GMs are natural advocates for our mission and thrive on outreach and community building. Sky is the limit with revenue sharing if you are organized and you like to grow.

Sound like a fun challenge?  Shoot us an email with a cover letter and resume!

Description:
This is a unique opportunity to work on a product that is transforming how professionals and individuals access and manage research articles. This position is perfect for someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit, likes tackling challenging problems, and enjoys having considerable autonomy on projects.

DeepDyve created a “Netflix for research” subscription service to revolutionize the $10B scientific and professional research industry.  Our initial users were scientists and researchers in small/mid-size businesses such as biopharma companies, high tech/clean tech startups, medical device co’s and non-profit organizations who desperately need authoritative research papers but lack the resources to pay for expensive journal subscriptions.  DeepDyve has partnered with over 150 leading academic publishers and aggregated over 20 million articles into a database subscription service where users have unlimited, read-only access (but not download and ‘own’) for a flat monthly/annual fee.

For corporate clients, the need is for an affordable digital library platform (or as some have referred to us, as a ‘Salesforce for research’) that enables researchers to discover, access, manage and share their literature projects – all from one place.

In supporting this new corporate client base, DeepDyve has built out its rental database into this digital library platform to enable search, access, collaboration, organization, storage and integration with other literature and enterprise tools, such as Slack.

Gather and organize design requirements for new products and features. Hear from all relevant parties.
Brainstorm and plan out the backend code as well as think through interactions with the front-end and ops infrastructure

Propose new product/feature ideas to improve the product and performance for both internal and external users

5+ yrs experience coding backend logic for web apps. Fewer than 5 years is ok if previous work is highly relevant and of excellent quality.

Other

description:
Fenwick & West is a top-tier law firm with an open and inclusive culture. With more than 400 lawyers and 400 employees in  Silicon Valley, San Francisco, Santa Monica, Seattle and New York, we work with companies on the cutting edge of technology, life sciences and cleantech. For more than four decades, our firm has helped some of the world's most recognized companies become and remain market leaders. We are proud to have been named one of the Best Places to Work in the Bay Area for the twelfth year.

Our IT department is looking for a Temporary Software Business Analyst (approximately 3 months) to assist in identifying and documenting requirements for a fast-paced, high-profile project for its Litigation practice group. The successful candidate will have familiarity with the Agile/SCRUM methodology, excellent analytical, verbal, and writing skills and will be able to quickly turn complex data and process requirements into Agile/SCRUM user stories for use by application developers. This individual will also be responsible for writing end-user tests for user stories and supporting end-users during those tests to ensure rapid review and sign-off of completed software features.

Responsibilities Include:
Interview Litigation attorneys, Knowledge Management staff, and others who support the Litigation practice to gather requirements
Development of process flow and data processing logic
Document needed data, automated processes, and other requirements using Visio flow diagrams, Excel, Word, or other standard tools
Convert requirements into Agile/SCRUM format user stories in Azure DevOps that are ready for application developers to estimate, schedule, and work on
Work closely with the application development team in the creation of these user stories
Create test plans for each user story using Azure DevOps test plans
Work with end-users of software to execute test plans to verify software meets user story acceptance criteria
Communicate between testers and applications developers regarding testing issues, questions, and concerns to expedite complete and thorough testing

Desired Skills and Qualifications:
Fluency in Microsoft Office suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, etc.)
Experience working on numerous Agile/SCRUM software projects and with writing Agile/SCRUM format user stories
Experience working directly with high-level professionals such as attorneys to gather requirements
Excellent data and process analytical abilities
Excellent verbal and writing skills

Reporting to the Director of Applications Development and Business Process, the ideal candidate will have 10+ years' experience as a software-focused business analyst. Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related discipline preferred. Law firm or professional services industry experience strongly preferred.

title: CRM Manager
description:
Do you want to use your valuable skills to help ensure that low income students and students of color in California receive a world class education? 

Join us!

About Innovate Public Schools
Innovate Public Schools is a nonprofit organization focused on ensuring that all students - especially low-income students, students of color, English learners and students with disabilities - receive a world-class education. We’re building a movement of families, educators, and business and elected leaders who together will make this vision a reality. We build the capacity of parents and educators to innovate and act together to create world-class public schools, and we publish easy-to-understand school quality data and research that highlights both problems and solutions.

Job Summary
Innovate is seeking an experienced CRM Manager to lead our efforts to capture, organize, use and analyze our data, supporting company wide objectives. This strategic doer will manage and implement the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and improvement of Innovate’s data systems. Salesforce is the backbone data system that allows us to reach and engage parents, schools and other stakeholders.  Working as both the Salesforce administrator and the solution architect, the CRM Manager will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption ofSalesforce.com throughout an organization, as well as insights into how to effectively leverage additional systems. The CRM Manager will work closely with Innovate’s team members to identify, manage and improve business processes to support Innovate’s core functions: Parent Organizing, School Support, Research, Communications, Events, Fundraising and Finance.  

This position is based in San Jose, CA, and reports to the Associate Director, Communications. This is a part-time, non-exempt position, approximately 20-25 hours per week. This role can be performed primarily remotely, with on average 1 day per week on-site in our San Jose office. The typical work schedule is flexible and will be set in conjunction with the manager. The salary is $60/hour.

Leadership & Systems Vision
-Oversees the strategy and day-to-day management of the Salesforce.com platform and associated technologies,  identifying and leading the implementation of new solutions across the organization and ensuring they are delivered in a way to achieve maximum business value.

-Partners with Data Team, RVPs and Leadership team to translate business priorities into technical solutions, drive simplification and alignment across all Innovate teams.

-Actively drives the development life-cycle from requirements analysis, feasibility estimates, design, code, documentation, testing, implementation, and support.

-Drives process management and system knowledge across all teams within the organization. Actively involved in change management and elevating importance of data-driven decision making.

-Keeps abreast of current and future trends and stays up to date with Salesforce releases, features, and best practices.

-Manages vendor relationships and associated projects.

Solution Architect
-Develops high-quality, well-tested solutions which meet/exceed the project timelines and objectives.

-Accountable for crafting, documenting, and enabling the system and data architecture for the Salesforce platform.

-Converts project requirements into an architecture and design that is the blueprint for the solution. Ensure solutions are implemented to support and scale with the existing architecture.

-Identifies, reduces, and eliminates technical debt within the platform.

-Aligns and implements best practices for the development and deployment of Salesforce-based solutions.

-Oversees all regression, UAT, and system integration testing for existing and new processes.

-Effectively utilizes sandbox architecture and Salesforce application release management processes.

-Identifies and implements partnerships and integrations as needed.

Salesforce Administration
-Performs hands-on configuration of all new and existing functionality including user management, security, custom objects, page layouts, validations, workflow, flows, process builders, reports, and dashboards.

-Creates and maintains documentation on processes, policies, application configuration, and help-related materials for users on all applications (Salesforce, MailChimp, etc.)

-Effectively leverages Salesforce configuration and technical/functional capabilities to meet stakeholder requirements.

-Implements and provides technical and functional support to users of Salesforce and related 3rd party integrations.

-Regularly audits data to uncover data integrity issues and/or opportunities for process improvement to improve system functionality and user experience. 

Business Analysis
-Works closely with internal stakeholders and leads discovery workshops to define requirements, develop, design, and implement solutions for various teams.

-Defines the current state and uncovers gaps utilizing Salesforce and related technology best practices. 

-Works collaboratively with team members to design solutions that meet business requirements and user stories.

Qualifications
-Proven track record as a successful technology leader with extensive experience on the Salesforce platform.

-Possess a solid understanding of application programming, database, and system design and business environments.

-Proven ability to communicate professionally, work in cross-functional collaborative teams, and implement organizational change management.

-Strong project management skills

-Demonstrated problem-solving skills

-Ability to work effectively in a consultative role with other senior staff and management.

-Experience in CRM migration.

Compensation & Benefits
The salary is $60/hour depending on experience. Innovate offers very generous benefits for half-time employees, including 5% employer contribution to 401k, as well as paid time off (PTO) at a rate of 0.077 hours of PTO per hour worked (after two years, this increases to 0.096 hours of PTO per hour worked). Innovate also offers eight hours per year floating holiday, and four hours per year paid to volunteer time off. Finally, Innovate also provides a reimbursement of up to $80 per month to compensate for your usage of a personal cell phone for work purposes.  

Work Environment / Physical Demands
The work environment characteristics and physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while successfully performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by the incumbent in this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills.

title: Director of Software Engineering
description:
About Us
We are a small, well established, and successful B2B company that provides SaaS solutions to prominent legal, consulting and corporate 1000 companies across the USA, retaining 98% of our customers over the past 15 years and achieving a NPS of +96 (https://www.customermonitor.com/blog/what-is-a-good-net-promoter-score).

As we enter our next phase of growth, we’re looking for a good person who is also an accomplished technology professional to join our tight-knit management team as a VP or Director of Software Engineering.  We will not grind you to the bone (we’re not a startup), nor will we dump problems upon you (we’re all in this together).

We are looking for a strong leader with the technical, strategic, and people skills required to build out our development team and move our products forward. For your efforts you will be amply rewarded both professionally and financially.

What You Will Be Doing
While this position is focused on software development and the management of the development team, you will also be expected to work with clients, business partners and other external entities as needed in support of the installations and ongoing sales of our products.
Initially the goals of this position are as outlined below, however these may be adjusted to suit the needs of the company from time to time.

•	Become an expert on our:
•	application architecture
•	development and release cycle
•	code base
•	source control methodology (Github)
•	continuous integration environment (Jenkins / Cloudwatch / etc.)
•	AWS production environment
•	Provide leadership and management to a team of software engineers, providing mentorship and guidance in delivering supportable and secure code, coordinating schedules, and enforcing time management and reporting. This also includes participating in the hiring process and helping to coordinate schedule of members of your team.
•	Contribute key code / features / enhancements to core products.
•	Release great code, frequently.
•	Work collaboratively with the executive team and client services team to identify and fix priority bugs, explain application design / architecture, and troubleshoot issues.

What We’re Looking For
•	A team member that is passionate about client service and delivering an outstanding solution  
•	At least 7 years of direct experience in software engineering and at least 3 years leading a team development effort
•	Engineering or similar degree (BSc/MSc in Engineering, Computer Science, etc.) or commensurate experience
•	Excellent programming skills in PHP 
•	Strong organizational leadership skills with a strategic mind
•	Excellent project management skills
•	Good understanding of agile methodologies

Our Tech
•	We write our core web apps in PHP, peppered with just the right amount of JavaScript
•	We deliver great applications/code through Continuous Integration using GitHub and Jenkins  
•	We host these great applications in Amazon’s Elastic Cloud
•	We are taking over the mobile shipping world with our iOS app (written in C++)
•	And, because our clients need us to, we speak native MS SQL, IIS

Working Conditions
Working conditions may vary. You will be expected to keep normal business hours, Pacific Time. While you’ll be working remotely initially, you’ll be expected to be in the office in the Northern Bay Area (Oakland/San Francisco, CA) on a mutually agreed upon schedule at least several times per month. As an exempt employee work may require occasional weekend and/or evening work.

Compensation
•	Commensurate with previous experience and demonstrated success
•	A full benefit package
•	Continuing education reimbursement
•	A great team of people committed to doing great work

How to Apply
Reply to this ad.  Tell us a little about yourself and what you’re all about.  Where are you headed, and where can you help us go?

Make sure to include a resume.

title: Lead Character Artist
description:
Job description

Your mission: 

As a Lead Character Artist you would be in charge of the characters and creatures from a visual quality and design standpoint of our next-gen cloud-native MMO. You would join a world-class team of game developers and work closely with our character team and game designers.  

The role is based preferably in Helsinki, alternatively in Reykjavik, but we are also open to discuss a remote role.  

Your responsibilities: 

You will define the benchmark standards and vision for the game’s characters and creatures for years to come in collaboration with the art & design leads.  
You will work with the tech artists and programming team to help define and implement workflows, pipelines and best practices for a game-as-service.  
You will communicate with other disciplines and guide the character modeling team and external vendors when needed.  
You will help define the production schedule for the characters and creatures together with our character team.  
You will maintain the quality throughout the production cycle and timely delivery of assets ensuring that the character assets follow our vision, specifications, quality bars and are functioning in the game as intended.  

What we are looking for: 

You have solid experience in AAA games and character creation, design process, pipelines, and tools.  
You have a passion for games, ideally RPGs and MMOs.  
You have expert knowledge of organic and hard surface modeling producing high-quality topology and UVs with inventive use of textures & shaders.  
You have extensive experience in working together with rigging and animation.  
You have an understanding of current and new character creation techniques and technologies and a desire to push quality while maintaining technical performance.  
You have experience in modular approaches to character creation and concepting process, human anatomy, materials, silhouettes, and the readability of the characters. 
You have comprehensive knowledge of industry-standard 3D and 2D software, Zbrush, Maya, Substance Painter, Marvelous Designer, Photoshop, etc. 
You have a strong knowledge of industry-standard pipelines and workflows, asset exporting process, and implementation within the game.  
Experience in working with UE4 is a big plus.
